reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 104/14: RATIOS OF JOURNEYPERSONS TO APPRENTICES
reg_info.act_under: Ontario College of Trades and Apprenticeship Act, 2009

content.content: 1. Without limiting the generality of section 8 of the Act, sponsors of apprentices in trades that are set out in this Regulation are required to comply with the prohibition in that section by not permitting an apprentice to work in a trade except in accordance with the ratio set out in this Regulation.
content.raw_html: 1. Without limiting the generality of section 8 of the Act, sponsors of apprentices in trades that are set out in this Regulation are required to comply with the prohibition in that section by not permitting an apprentice to work in a trade except in accordance with the ratio set out in this Regulation.

content.content: 2. For the purposes of this Regulation, where the person who employs an apprentice in a trade is a journeyperson in the trade, that person is considered the first journeyperson for purposes of determining the journeyperson to apprentice ratio in the trade. Ratios of Journeypersons to Apprentices
content.raw_html:
2. For the purposes of this Regulation, where the person who employs an apprentice in a trade is a journeyperson in the trade, that person is considered the first journeyperson for purposes of determining the journeyperson to apprentice ratio in the trade.

Ratios of Journeypersons to Apprentices

content.content: 3. The number of apprentices who may be sponsored or employed by a person in the trade of architectural glass and metal technician in relation to the number of journeypersons employed by the person in the trade shall not exceed, (a) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice; and (b) for every two additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice.
content.raw_html:
3. The number of apprentices who may be sponsored or employed by a person in the trade of architectural glass and metal technician in relation to the number of journeypersons employed by the person in the trade shall not exceed,

(a) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice; and

(b) for every two additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice.

content.content: 10. The number of apprentices who may be sponsored or employed by a person in the trade of electrician — construction and maintenance in relation to the number of journeypersons employed by the person in the trade shall not exceed, (a) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice; (b) for the second journeyperson, an additional apprentice; (c) for the third journeyperson, an additional apprentice; (d) for the fourth journeyperson, an additional apprentice; (e) for the next three additional journeypersons, an additional apprentice; (f) for the next six additional journeypersons, an additional apprentice; and (g) for every three additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice.

10. The number of apprentices who may be sponsored or employed by a person in the trade of electrician — construction and maintenance in relation to the number of journeypersons employed by the person in the trade shall not exceed,

(b) for the second journeyperson, an additional apprentice;

(c) for the third journeyperson, an additional apprentice;

(d) for the fourth journeyperson, an additional apprentice;

(e) for the next three additional journeypersons, an additional apprentice;

content.content: 11. The number of apprentices who may be sponsored or employed by a person in the trade of electrician — domestic and rural in relation to the number of journeypersons employed by the person in the trade shall not exceed, (a) where the work of the trade is not being done in the low rise residential sector, (i) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice, (ii) for the second journeyperson, an additional apprentice, (iii) for the third journeyperson, an additional apprentice, (iv) for the fourth journeyperson, an additional apprentice, (v) for the next three journeypersons, an additional apprentice, (vi) for the next six journeypersons, an additional apprentice, and (vii) for every three additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice; or (b) where the work of the trade is being done in the low rise residential sector, (i) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice, (ii) for the second journeyperson, an additional apprentice, (iii) for the third journeyperson, an additional apprentice, (iv) for the fourth journeyperson, an additional apprentice, (v) for the next three journeypersons, an additional apprentice, (vi) for the next five journeypersons, an additional apprentice, and (vii) for every two additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice.
content.raw_html:
11. The number of apprentices who may be sponsored or employed by a person in the trade of electrician — domestic and rural in relation to the number of journeypersons employed by the person in the trade shall not exceed,

(a) where the work of the trade is not being done in the low rise residential sector,

(i) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice,

(ii) for the second journeyperson, an additional apprentice,

(iii) for the third journeyperson, an additional apprentice,

(iv) for the fourth journeyperson, an additional apprentice,

(v) for the next three journeypersons, an additional apprentice,

(vi) for the next six journeypersons, an additional apprentice, and

(vii) for every three additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice; or

(b) where the work of the trade is being done in the low rise residential sector,

(i) for the first journeyperson, one apprentice,

(ii) for the second journeyperson, an additional apprentice,

(iii) for the third journeyperson, an additional apprentice,

(iv) for the fourth journeyperson, an additional apprentice,

(v) for the next three journeypersons, an additional apprentice,

(vi) for the next five journeypersons, an additional apprentice, and

(vii) for every two additional journeypersons thereafter, an additional apprentice.
